001
002package io.vrap.rmf.base.client.utils.json;
003
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.InputStream;
006import java.util.*;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.*;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.module.SimpleModule;
013import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ArrayNode;
014import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode;
015import com.fasterxml.jackson.datatype.jsr310.JavaTimeModule;
016
017import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.utils.json.modules.ModuleOptions;
018import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.utils.json.modules.ZonedDateTimeDeserializationModule;
019import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.utils.json.modules.ZonedDateTimeSerializationModule;
020
021/**
022 * Class with methods to customize the JSON serialization/deserialization
023 */
024public class JsonUtils {
025
026    private static final ObjectMapper OBJECT_MAPPER;
027
028    static {
029        OBJECT_MAPPER = createObjectMapper();
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * creates a new {@link ObjectMapper } instance
034     * @return ObjectMapper
035     */
036    public static ObjectMapper createObjectMapper() {
037        return createObjectMapper(name -> null);
038    }
039
040    /**
041     *
042     * @param options configuration for jackson modules supplied by a {@link ModuleSupplier}
043     * @return ObjectMapper
044     */
045    public static ObjectMapper createObjectMapper(final ModuleOptions options) {
046        ServiceLoader<SimpleModule> loader = ServiceLoader.load(SimpleModule.class,
047            SimpleModule.class.getClassLoader());
048
049        ServiceLoader<ModuleSupplier> suppliers = ServiceLoader.load(ModuleSupplier.class,
050            ModuleSupplier.class.getClassLoader());
051        final List<SimpleModule> moduleList = new ArrayList<>();
052        suppliers.iterator().forEachRemaining(moduleSupplier -> moduleList.add(moduleSupplier.getModule(options)));
053
054        final ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();
055        objectMapper.registerModule(new JavaTimeModule()) //provides serialization and deserialization for LocalDate and LocalTime (JSR310 Jackson module)
056                .registerModule(new ZonedDateTimeSerializationModule()) //custom serializer for LocalDate, LocalTime and ZonedDateTime
057                .registerModule(new ZonedDateTimeDeserializationModule()) //custom deserializer for ZonedDateTime
058                .registerModules(loader)
059                .registerModules(moduleList)
060                .setSerializationInclusion(JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL) //ignore null fields
061                .configure(DeserializationFeature.FAIL_ON_UNKNOWN_PROPERTIES, false)
062                .configure(SerializationFeature.FAIL_ON_EMPTY_BEANS, false);
063        return objectMapper;
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * serializes the given object to JSON as a byte array
068     * @param value object to be serialized
069     * @return json byte array
070     * @throws JsonProcessingException serialization errors
071     */
072    public static byte[] toJsonByteArray(final Object value) throws JsonProcessingException {
073        return OBJECT_MAPPER.writeValueAsBytes(value);
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * serializes the given object to JSON as a byte array
078     * @param value object to be serialized
079     * @return json string
080     * @throws JsonProcessingException serialization errors
081     */
082    public static String toJsonString(final Object value) throws JsonProcessingException {
083        return OBJECT_MAPPER.writeValueAsString(value);
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * deserializes the given json string to the given class
088     * @param clazz class to serialize to
089     * @param content json as string
090     * @return deserialized object
091     */
092    public static <T> T fromJsonString(final String content, final Class<T> clazz) {
093        return executing(() -> OBJECT_MAPPER.readValue(content, clazz));
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Reads a Java object from JSON data (String).
098     *
099     * @param jsonAsString  the JSON data which represents sth. of type {@code <T>}
100     * @param typeReference the full generic type information about the object to create
101     * @param <T>           the type of the result
102     * @return the created objected
103     */
104    public static <T> T fromJsonString(final String jsonAsString, final TypeReference<T> typeReference) {
105        return executing(() -> OBJECT_MAPPER.readValue(jsonAsString, typeReference));
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Reads a Java object from JsonNode data.
110     * <p>
111     *
112     * @param jsonNode      the JSON data which represents sth. of type {@code <T>}
113     * @param typeReference the full generic type information about the object to create
114     * @param <T>           the type of the result
115     * @return the created objected
116     */
117    public static <T> T fromJsonNode(final JsonNode jsonNode, final TypeReference<T> typeReference) {
118        return executing(() -> OBJECT_MAPPER.readerFor(typeReference).readValue(jsonNode));
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Converts a commercetools platform Java object to JSON as {@link JsonNode}.
123     * <p>If {@code value} is of type String and contains JSON data, that will be ignored, {@code value} will be treated as just any String.
124     * If you want to parse a JSON String to a JsonNode use {@link JsonUtils#parse(java.lang.String)} instead.</p>
125     * <p>
126     *
127     * @param value the object to convert
128     * @return new json
129     */
130    public static JsonNode toJsonNode(final Object value) {
131        return OBJECT_MAPPER.valueToTree(value);
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Parses a String containing JSON data and produces a {@link JsonNode}.
136     *
137     * @param jsonAsString json data
138     * @return new JsonNode
139     */
140    public static JsonNode parse(final String jsonAsString) {
141        return executing(() -> OBJECT_MAPPER.readTree(jsonAsString));
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * deserializes the given json string to the given class
146     * @param clazz class to serialize to
147     * @param content json as byte array
148     * @return deserialized object
149     * @throws JsonException deserialization errors
150     */
151    public static <T> T fromJsonByteArray(final byte[] content, final Class<T> clazz) {
152        return executing(() -> OBJECT_MAPPER.readValue(content, clazz));
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * deserializes the given json string to the given class
157     * @param clazz class to serialize to
158     * @param content json as inputstream
159     * @return deserialized object
160     * @throws JsonException deserialization errors
161     */
162    public static <T> T fromInputStream(final InputStream content, final Class<T> clazz) {
163        return executing(() -> OBJECT_MAPPER.readValue(content, clazz));
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * default {@link ObjectMapper}
168     * @return ObjectMapper
169     */
170    public static ObjectMapper getConfiguredObjectMapper() {
171        return OBJECT_MAPPER;
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Very simple way to "erase" passwords -
176     * replaces all field values whose names contains {@code 'pass'} by {@code '**removed from output**'}.
177     * @param node Json object to be redacted
178     * @return Json object
179     */
180    private static JsonNode secure(final JsonNode node) {
181        if (node.isObject()) {
182            ObjectNode objectNode = (ObjectNode) node;
183            Iterator<Map.Entry<String, JsonNode>> fields = node.fields();
184            while (fields.hasNext()) {
185                Map.Entry<String, JsonNode> field = fields.next();
186                if (field.getValue().isTextual() && (field.getKey().toLowerCase().contains("pass")
187                        || field.getKey().toLowerCase().contains("access_token")
188                        || field.getKey().toLowerCase().contains("refresh_token"))) {
189                    objectNode.put(field.getKey(), "**removed from output**");
190                }
191                else {
192                    secure(field.getValue());
193                }
194            }
195            return objectNode;
196        }
197        else if (node.isArray()) {
198            ArrayNode arrayNode = (ArrayNode) node;
199            Iterator<JsonNode> elements = arrayNode.elements();
200            while (elements.hasNext()) {
201                secure(elements.next());
202            }
203            return arrayNode;
204        }
205        else {
206            return node;
207        }
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Pretty prints a given JSON string.
212     *
213     * @param json JSON code as String which should be formatted
214     * @return <code>json</code> formatted
215     */
216    public static String prettyPrint(final String json) {
217        return executing(() -> {
218            final ObjectMapper jsonParser = new ObjectMapper();
219            final JsonNode jsonTree = jsonParser.readValue(json, JsonNode.class);
220            secure(jsonTree);
221            final ObjectWriter writer = jsonParser.writerWithDefaultPrettyPrinter();
222            return writer.writeValueAsString(jsonTree);
223        });
224    }
225
226    public static <T> T executing(final SupplierThrowingIOException<T> supplier) {
227        try {
228            return supplier.get();
229        }
230        catch (final IOException e) {
231            throw new JsonException(e);
232        }
233    }
234
235    @FunctionalInterface
236    public interface SupplierThrowingIOException<T> {
237        T get() throws IOException;
238    }
239}
